pullrequest.title: Show and Revoke permissions in User Metrics

content.raw:
Something to keep in mind, besides this particular case: Always try to be consistent. If you are mapping `on-granted` to `_onGranted` and `on-revoked` to `_onRevoked` then `on-got` should be `_onGot`. However, I would argue that we should be as explicit as possible, hence mapping like `on-granted` to `_onGrantedPermission`, `on-revoked` to `_onRevokedPermission` and `on-got` to `_onGotPermission (same applies to `on-permissionsupdated`). In any case, no matter what mapping you choose, you should make them consistent. 

Also note that this applies to the other components you have in this page that hook callbacks.
content.html:
Something to keep in mind, besides this particular case: Always try to be consistent. If you are mapping on-granted to _onGranted and on-revoked to _onRevoked then on-got should be _onGot. However, I would argue that we should be as explicit as possible, hence mapping like on-granted to _onGrantedPermission, on-revoked to _onRevokedPermission and on-got to _onGotPermission (same applies toon-permissionsupdated`). In any case, no matter what mapping you choose, you should make them consistent.

Also note that this applies to the other components you have in this page that hook callbacks.
